headline: The Metadata Of the Carnal
abstract: Garth Greenwell’s second novel is about a middle-aged American teacher’s sexual and existential journey while working in Bulgaria.
lead_paragraph: “Physical love is unthinkable without violence,” Milan Kundera wrote in “The Unbearable Lightness of Being.” Some of the most essential recent fiction has surveyed the pain and pleasure of being on the receiving end of violent physical expression. There’s been a lot to absorb about submission.
